intro: Anatherostipa, commonly known as the "flowerless grass," is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. These plants are characterized by their absence of true flowers, instead producing spikelets that resemble inflorescences. They are typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Anatherostipa species often have narrow, grass-like leaves and produce small, inconspicuous flowers that are not easily visible. Their botanical significance lies in their unique reproductive structures and ecological adaptations to dry climates.
